headline.main: Salvadorans Illegally in U.S. Are Given Protected Status

lead_paragraph: President Bush agreed today to allow as many as 150,000 Salvadorans to remain in the United States for up to 18 months to help El Salvador recover from a series of devastating earthquakes earlier this year. Most of the Salvadorans are in this country without legal visas or work permits. President Francisco Flores of El Salvador had requested that the administration grant ''temporary protected status'' to thousands of his countrymen living illegally here, saying that money they earn in the United States and send to relatives back home would be as valuable to rebuilding efforts as increased American aid.
abstract: Pres Bush agrees to let up to 150,000 Salvadorans, most of them in United States illegally, remain in US with protected status for up to 18 months to help El Salvador recover from devastating earthquakes, meeting with Pres Francisco Flores; Flores sought move, holding money illegal immigrants send home is crucial to rebuilding effort; Bush also pledges $52 million in reconstruction aid this year and same amount or more next year (M)
